intro: Koanophyllon scabriusculum, commonly known as the roughleaf blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, gray-green leaves that are adapted to arid conditions. Its small blue to purple flowers bloom in late spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Koanophyllon scabriusculum is a perennial herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native ecosystems.
